doc.title: Appendix D: Standard on Information Technology User and Workpoint Profiles

chapter.title: Standard on Information Technology User and Workpoint Profiles

clauses.clause: These profiles provide details in support of requirement 4.4.1.1 of the Directive on Service and Digital.

clause.p: The identified user profiles are as follows:

clauses.clause: GC IT User â A general IT user equipped to work at and away from a workpoint, outside of GC offices, or in telework or remote work situations.
Remote/Field User â A user who principally works remotely.
Call Centre User â A user whose role involves high telephone use.
High-security User â A GC IT User who works in high security zone.
Policing/Enforcement/Intelligence User â A user who works remotely with specific rugged gear and mobile tech related to policing, enforcement, or intelligence services.
Scientist / Lab User â A user requiring additional resources due to responsibilities in their research field.
Data Scientist / Analyst â A user requiring additional resources due to the manipulation of large data sets.
Software Developer / Power User / Graphic Designer â A user requiring additional resources for software development, graphics design, or to support use of resource-intensive applications.

International User â A user who works in an international office or travels frequently internationally, requiring long-distance telephony configurations and broader secure access options.Â Possibly in a high-risk environment.

clause.p: The identified individual workpoint profiles are as follows:

clauses.clause: Generic Workpoint â A non-specific workpoint with basic IT requirements.
Fixed-Line Workpoint â A workpoint that requires fixed network or telephony connectivity.
High-Security Workpoint â A secure workpoint in a high security zone.
High-Bandwidth Workpoint â A workpoint with access to high-speed networking.
Small Workpoint â A small shared closed or open workpoint, meant for short-term work.
Phone Booth â A small enclosed workpoint with a fixed telephony device for private calls.

clause.p: The identified collaborative workpoint profiles are as follows:

clauses.clause: Boardroom â A small, medium, or large room for collective work and meetings.
Collaborative Space â An unstructured space for collaboration.
Equipment Area â An area for print and communication devices
Lobby â The entrance area to a building
Public Access Zone â Any publicly available and open area on GC building premises other than the lobby.

dl.dd: An agreement between the user and the employer to work outside of a government office.
An operational requirement by the employer to work outside of a government office.
